intro: Spergularia azorica, commonly known as Azorean sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve moisture in its arid habitat. Spergularia azorica is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits.
